noun.description: A long narrow ridge or mound of sand or gravel deposited by a stream flowing beneath a glacier; = "esker". Usually in plural Compare "kame".

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in Geologist. From French osar and its etymon Swedish åsar, plural of ås ridge of a hill (Old Swedish aas, cognate with Old Icelandic áss (Icelandic ás), Norwegian ås, Danish ås, of uncertain origin; probably further cognate with Gothic ams shoulder from the same Indo-European base as classical Latin umerus shoulder).
